noun.description: A connecting band of tissue, such as that attaching a flexor tendon to the bone of a finger or toe.
A horizontal line drawn over a group of terms in a mathematical expression to indicate that they are to be operated on as a single entity by the preceding or following operator.

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense bond, tie): from Latin, literally bond, from vincire bind. The term has been used in anatomy since the mid 19th century.
